intro: Corchorus guadalupensis, commonly known as Guadalupine knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Corchorus guadalupensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along streambanks.
